renewableEnergySources.title: Solar Energy
renewableEnergySources.description: Solar energy harnesses the power of the sun to generate electricity through photovoltaic (PV) panels.

renewableEnergySources.title: Wind Energy
renewableEnergySources.description: Wind turbines capture the kinetic energy of the wind and convert it into electricity.

renewableEnergySources.title: Hydropower
renewableEnergySources.description: Hydropower utilizes the energy of flowing or falling water to generate electricity.

renewableEnergySources.title: Geothermal Energy
renewableEnergySources.description: Geothermal energy utilizes the heat from the Earth's core to generate electricity or heat buildings.

renewableEnergySources.title: Biomass Energy
renewableEnergySources.description: Biomass energy is derived from organic materials, such as plant matter, agricultural residues, and wood.

renewableEnergySources.title: Wave Energy
renewableEnergySources.description: Wave energy converts the motion of ocean waves into electricity.
